oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pocket Testament
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This pocket testament from the American Bible Society published in 1864 was given to Sgt. Francis Marion Cannon, Co. E, 3rd KY Mtd. Inf., CSA while he was a prisoner of war. Cannon was captured at the Battle of Harrisburg, Mississippi (near Tupelo) on; July 14, 1864. Cannon wrote his experiences in the back end pieces of the testament and mentions being sent to Camp Douglas and later to a smallpox hospital. He survived the war.
